channel.title: Emulating phone onto computer
channel.description:
Is there a way I can use my phone on my computer?
My phones screen is broken and I can't do much on it. Can I connect it to my computer and use it on that??

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:15, topic:547970”]best bet is to get free trial of prime on Amazon and order the Hdmi to micro connector (again check compatibility within the pins) and get the 2 day shipping. or go to a store and buy one.

edit, Nevermind. your digitizer doesn’t work so it won’t work with the Hdmi or any screen mirroring software. you’re going to need to replace it or figure out how to get developer mode for non market apps installed / access to adb[/quote]
I managed to get into developer mode, found a small portion of the screen that works. Took me a good 2 hours to find that one tiny spot.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

best bet is to get free trial of prime on Amazon and order the Hdmi to micro connector (again check compatibility within the pins) and get the 2 day shipping. or go to a store and buy one.

edit, Nevermind. your digitizer doesn’t work so it won’t work with the Hdmi or any screen mirroring software. you’re going to need to replace it or figure out how to get developer mode for non market apps installed / access to adb

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:13, topic:547970”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=666875.msg4459311#msg4459311 date=1416687417]
If you can adb into your phone you could always try and install a vnc server and remotely connect to your phone.
Something like this: https://code.google.com/p/fastdroid-vnc/
Unsure if that particular solution still works on newer version of android but that’s the general idea.
[/quote]
That requires developer mode being turned on, which is nearly impossible with a broken digitizer.[/quote]
It’s impossible now. It’s at a point where you can’t click anything.

Have to use my headphones to answer calls with.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:12, topic:547970”]If you can adb into your phone you could always try and install a vnc server and remotely connect to your phone.
Something like this: https://code.google.com/p/fastdroid-vnc/
Unsure if that particular solution still works on newer version of android but that’s the general idea.[/quote]
That requires developer mode being turned on, which is nearly impossible with a broken digitizer.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If you can adb into your phone you could always try and install a vnc server and remotely connect to your phone.
Something like this: https://code.google.com/p/fastdroid-vnc/
Unsure if that particular solution still works on newer version of android but that’s the general idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

then you’re more than likely out of luck unless there’s something on the market I don’t know about. you’re best bet is buying a micro to Hdmi cable (check how many pins your phone requires because I know some are different - mainly galaxies.)

or buying a new screen.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Vain_:

by any chance do you have the setting enabled for non market applications?

Not sure, I never enabled that myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

by any chance do you have the setting enabled for non market applications?

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

PaulT:

So its not really a question of emulating, you want to access your phone via GUI on your PC. Depending on what flavor of android your running it shouldn’t be too hard, if you can’t find anything via google then post more info about your device maybe someone here can help. I think you should be able to do it multiple ways with existing apps/methods. Google is your friend (~.^)

Tried many ways. I got a xperia z3.

I can’t use my phone at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

So its not really a question of emulating, you want to access your phone via GUI on your PC. Depending on what flavor of android your running it shouldn’t be too hard, if you can’t find anything via google then post more info about your device maybe someone here can help. I think you should be able to do it multiple ways with existing apps/methods. Google is your friend (~.^)

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

oh right, you can always connect most modern phone to other monitors.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

HcoJustin:

The Z3 supports HDMI out and screen mirroring, as well as USB OTG or Bluetooth for mouse/keyboard support.

Can I use USB to mirror? I don’t have a HDMI cable or a HDMI port on my monitor. I can’t access my phone at all, would I need to change any settings?

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

The Z3 supports HDMI out and screen mirroring, as well as USB OTG or Bluetooth for mouse/keyboard support.

As for an emulator, sure you could load the z3 rom with the android emulator, but you couldn’t use the cell network so its pretty much useless

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

t4:

not that i am aware of, however android (and probably ios) have emulators (which obviously aren’t connected to cell networks) for development purposes.

Well I know there’s bluestack but I need something that can use cell network, I was hoping I could maybe use my computer as a screen for my phone.

I saw a few things online, gonna give it a shot. Just downloading the android sdk atm.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulating phone onto computer
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

not that i am aware of, however android (and probably ios) have emulators (which obviously aren’t connected to cell networks) for development purposes.
